tool.name: ODV
tool.description: interactive plotting tool for geo-referenced data
tool.command:
export HOME=\$PWD && mkdir -p Documents/ODV/.temp/ && mkdir -p Documents/ODV/galaxy/outputs && mkdir -p Documents/ODV/galaxy/data && mkdir -p Documents/ODV/galaxy/views && chmod 777 Documents/ODV/ -R &&
#if $auto_launch.launch == 'no': #if $method.type == 'own_data' : #for $i, $infile in enumerate($method.infiles): #if $infile.ext == "netcdf": cp '$infile' './Documents/ODV/galaxy/data/${infile.element_identifier}_${i}.nc' && #else: cp '$infile' './Documents/ODV/galaxy/data/${infile.element_identifier}' && #end if #end for #end if #if $method.type == 'zip' : #import re
#set zip_file_path = $method.folder #set source_folder_name = re.sub('[^\s\w\-]', '_', str($zip_file_path))
unzip "$zip_file_path" -d './Documents/ODV/galaxy/data/$source_folder_name' && #end if #if $views.view == 'yes': #for $i, $load_view in enumerate($views.input_view): cp '$load_view' './Documents/ODV/galaxy/views/${infile.element_identifier}.xview' && #end for #end if /init ;
#else: export ODV_ARG1=-x && cp '$auto_launch.load_data' './Documents/ODV/galaxy/data/${auto_launch.load_data.element_identifier}' && echo "open_data_file \$(ls \$PWD/Documents/ODV/galaxy/data/*)" > \$PWD/Documents/ODV/galaxy/qualification_oxygen.cmd && export ODV_ARG2=\$PWD/Documents/ODV/galaxy/qualification_oxygen.cmd &&
#if $views.view == 'yes': #for $i, $infile in enumerate($views.input_view): cp '$infile' './Documents/ODV/galaxy/views/${infile.element_identifier}.xview' && #end for echo "load_view \$(ls \$PWD/Documents/ODV/galaxy/views/*)" >> \$PWD/Documents/ODV/galaxy/qualification_oxygen.cmd && #end if /init ODV_ARG1 ODV_ARG2; #end if
mv ./Documents/ODV/galaxy/outputs/ ./output && rm ./Documents -rf && cd ./output && sleep 2 && for file in *; do mv "\$file" "\$file.\${file\#\#*.}"; done

param.name: launch
param.label: Do you want your data to be automatically load when ODV is launched ?
param.option: No, I want to manage the launch myself
Yes, I want my data to be loaded directly

param.name: type
param.label: Select if you are using a ODV collection in a zip folder or if you have your own raw data
param.option: The data you are using are a ODV collection in a zip folder
The data you are using are Netcdf or tabular text files

param.name: infiles
param.label: Netcdf or tabular text file. For text file, odv format is recommanded.

param.name: folder
param.label: ODV collection in a zip folder.
param.help: Must contain the specific folder structure with file.odv and folder.Data

param.name: load_data
param.label: Netcdf or tabular text file. For text file, odv format is recommanded.

param.name: view
param.label: Do you have a view ?
param.option: No, I don't have any view
Yes, I have my own view

tool.help: `ODV <https://odv.awi.de/>`_ plots geo-referenced and other arrays from netCDF, HDF, GRIB, and other datasets. For now, Galaxy is supporting only netCDF and text files as odv text file as input.
